What is the version of python in ubuntu: python2.5 and 2.6 are also in the repos, as is 3.1 and 3.2

I wouldn't do it globally, as many things in Ubuntu use python, and may require a specific version.  You can use #!/usr/bin/env python2.5   (or whatever) at the top of your scripts to force a particular version (assuming you have that installed of course)
